meanings.definition: Work hard over a period of time.
meanings.sent1: She had to slog through her homework all night.
meanings.sent2: He slogs away at his job every day without complaint.
meanings.sent3: The ants slogged through the dirt carrying food for their colony.
meanings.sent4: The old car slogged up the steep hill, struggling with each turn of the wheel.
meanings.sent5: The determined student slogged through the difficult math problems until she finally understood.

meanings.definition: A long, tiring walk or march.
meanings.sent1: After a long slog through the forest, they finally reached the campsite.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers faced a difficult slog through the muddy battlefield.
meanings.sent3: The family's hike turned into a slog when they got lost in the woods.
meanings.sent4: The marathon was a real slog, but she pushed through to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The delivery person's daily slog up and down the steep hills kept them in great shape.

meanings.sent1: He slogged the ball out of the park with a powerful swing.
meanings.sent2: The boxer slogged his opponent with a series of quick punches.
meanings.sent3: The chef slogged the dough to make the perfect bread loaf.
meanings.sent4: The storm slogged the coast, causing widespread damage.
meanings.sent5: The lumberjack slogged the tree with all his might, bringing it down in one swift blow.
